intro: Therogeron tenuifolius, commonly known as the slender-leafed therogeron, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant features finely divided, linear leaves that give it a delicate appearance, and its small, white to pale yellow flowers are arranged in umbels. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
